articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin will visit China on Thursday for talks with Xi Jinping that the Kremlin hopes will deepen a strategic partnership between the two most powerful geopolitical rivals of the United States.
articles.title: Putin to visit China's Xi to deepen strategic partnership

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico was injured in a shooting after a government meeting, news agency TASR reported on Wednesday.
articles.title: Slovak PM Fico shot and injured, TASR agency reports

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, James Mackenzie
articles.description: Israeli troops fought militants across Gaza on Wednesday, including in the southern city of Rafah that had been a refuge for civilians, in an upsurge of the more than seven-month war that has killed tens of thousands of Palestinians.
articles.title: Battles rage across Gaza, Israel releases images of armed men at UN site

articles.author: Jonathan Landay, Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The United States aims to have a floating pier in place off the Gaza Strip coast in the coming days to boost aid deliveries, but Washington is facing the same challenges that have beset the United Nations and relief groups for months when it comes to distributing assistance to the war-torn enclave.
articles.title: US aid pier for Gaza floats into wartime reality

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The number of people killed by weekend flash floods and mud slides in Indonesia's West Sumatra province has risen to 67 and 20 are still missing, authorities said on Thursday, as the government plans to relocate survivors to safer areas.
articles.title: Indonesia's death toll rises to 67 from Sumatra floods, 20 still missing

articles.author: Ben Blanchard, Yimou Lee
articles.description: Lai Ching-te takes office as Taiwan's president on Monday, facing a China that calls him a "dangerous separatist" and has ramped up military drills, as well as a fractured parliament at home where no party has a majority.
articles.title: Taiwan's incoming president faces angry China, fractured parliament

articles.author: Kirsty Needham, Camille Raynaud
articles.description: Armed forces were protecting New Caledonia's two airports and port after a third night of violent riots that have killed four people, the Pacific Island's top French official said on Thursday morning, adding at least four alleged instigators were under house arrest.
articles.title: Hundreds arrested, roads barricaded in New Caledonia as riots continue

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Gordon Black, a U.S. soldier being held in the Russian city of Vladivostok, has pleaded guilty to theft charges and is cooperating with investigators, Russia's RIA state news agencies reported on Thursday.
articles.title: US soldier held in Russia pleads guilty, RIA agency reports

articles.author: Lewis Jackson
articles.description: Donald Trump gave the AUKUS defence pact a "warm reception", during a meeting with former Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison, the latter said, one of the few public signs about Trump's view of the deal.
articles.title: Donald Trump is supportive of AUKUS defence pact, former Australian PM says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China has not responded to U.S. nuclear-weapons risk-reduction proposals and Washington has questions about Beijing's call for no-first-use talks while China continues to build up its arsenal, the top U.S. arms control official said on Wednesday.
articles.title: US questions China's no-first-use nuclear call given buildup
